author: あき
text:
いやそういうゲームだよ
今までのゲームへの固定概念をメタってる（使い方あってる？）ゲームだから、このルートこそが初見の正規ルートとも言える、と思ってるよ。

まぁ何にせよ感じたまま、感じないまま、思い通りプレイすれば神ゲームなんだから
みんなの思う通りにしないとなんて思わせたくない。

攻略Wiki見てから初見装ってプレイすりゃ不満も出ないだろうけど、そんなの見たくないな。

text:
@せかい  
なるほど確かに気付いてない事にモヤモヤはあるのかもしれないね
選べる選択肢に気付かないからもったいない
もっと理解を深めればより良いプレイになる
せっかくの良い演出を逃して進んでる
とかねすごくよく分かるよ

ただ　単に気付いてないのではないと思うよ
たくさん指示のコメントがあったから
複雑だったろうな
コメント見ないで欲しかったな

全てが正規ルート
本当にそうだね思い上がってたかな
素晴らしいゲームだよねアンダーテール

author: Cone is egg
text:
IMO it's much better to play this game starting off with the neutral route and treating it like a normal RPG. Because once you finish the route and finally realise all along that you could've spared everyone, you might be more emotionally invested in replaying and trying to be a pacifist. It's like when we regret our past decisions and want to go back in time to fix those mistakes.
EDIT: Also it seems like backseaters in the chat don't actually know how the genocide route works

author: Ed Boi
text: I couldn’t be more happy that she chose to play her own way. seriously, this game’s fandom is painful to see when someone is new to the game and people just flood the chat telling them what to do.

author: PK Scratch
text:
It is nice to see Rushia play this blind and without influence/backseating. The crazy Undertale fanbase is mostly why I dread anyone doing a blind playthrough of this game, comes with potentially huge baggage.

And honestly it's not like they'd be missing out that much. It's a good fun game, but it's not as overwhelmingly great as people make it out to be. So that adds to whether it's worth potentially triggering the mad mob of fans for a pure blind untainted playthrough.

inb4 some fan decides to yell at me for saying the game is skippable and just good or attempts to make a neutral sounding underhanded insult at me for this opinion.

author: Lionel K.Y
text:
You know what i fcking hate more then backseaters? 
People playing hero and trying to police them
I find them equally or more annoying at times because sometimes chat just reacts to characters dying and saying "Noooo" and then sudeenly i see someone going "Let her play the way she wants" 
Bruh the game is designed for us to be attached to these characters of course we'll fcking react when they get murdered

author: doc hendrix
text:
@Lionel K.Y  the game is designed to be played blind though, clearly. It isn't a collaborative effort. Arguably it's not a good game to stream, really.

I get that policing people is obnoxious but backseating sucks hard in a game like this.

If people can't respect that out of a need to express themselves regarding the fate of their favourite characters then that just sounds a bit selfish and dare I say immature.

The game and all of it's possible outcomes is part of the whole package.

Not too far from insisting that someone uses a certain weapon in COD or plays a certain character in tekken. It's just a bit asshole-ish and unnecessary.

author: Lionel K.Y
text:
@doc hendrix  Yeah but policing isn't gonna stop them too
Better to just ignore them and move on it's not like Rushia can read them anyways

author: Aer0z
text: I actually think playthroughs like Rushia’s work REALLY well when it comes to the replay value of Undertale. If you go through the game as a regular RPG, it makes replays of it MUCH more different because of how the ****** route has so many more character interactions; you get the benefit of experiencing the game firsthand while also having a fresh new game when you go back, and I think that’s brilliant, not only from a gameplay standpoint, but also as a viewer watching her stream.

text: @John Gomez  yeah it went just as backseaters spam as you would imagine. Fortunately? She stated she has already played through undertale before. However, I think she mentioned she never did genocide. She mentioned about how it sounded really difficult from Subaru's playthrough. And yet quite a number of people had the audacity to push for her to do the pacifist route despite the fact she's already seemed to have done it. I think she decided to do Genocide next after the neutral ending. Honestly, she probably shouldn't have to play the pacifist endings if she has already done it because she already knows the story. So there is very little she can genuinely react to. Neutral, I can understand because she needs to refresh herself on the story.

author: こなた
text:
コメント欄の荒れの原因
まとめることでみんな納得できると思います。
①青攻撃の時に動いてしまう
これは初プレイなので仕方ないですね。温かい目で見守りましょう。文章をよく読めという指示もありますが、これはアンダーテールをより楽しんで欲しいというアンダーテールプレイヤーからの温かい意見なのであまりこの指示を批判しないようにしませんか。

②視聴者間のルートに対する意見の不一致
これはパピルスを倒した時にGルートになっちゃったというコメントが多いことから荒れの原因になりました。これはルート分岐点を全く理解していない一部の視聴者に非があるので、今後こう言ったことがあっても完全に無視した方がいいと思います。

るしあには気持ちよく全ルートプレイして欲しいですし、そのためには指摘やアドバイスは必要だと思います。ただまず一周目、Nルートが確定しているので分岐とか考えずにるしあの思うままにプレイして欲しいですね！

text: It's really common for the game like this to has "Toxic" community. Everything up to the content creator to make a better experience for the viewer.

author: Charley Joergensen
text: @Salamander Man  I mean, she is a necromancer. Death for her probably isn’t the same “death” it is for us

author: Charley Joergensen
text: @Aoki  to be fair, undertale has probably one of the least toxic communities compared to a lot of other games. It definitely is an issue with how they try to push the pacifist run on to others, but I think it’s more people forgetting that others need their own first experience, than them actually trying to force the gameplay. Because most people watch these gameplays for the content creators reaction, they often forget to let them have their time going through the game their way so that they can see the reactions to the stronger story points, which I believe goes for pretty much any game with a powerful story like undertale

text: @Charley Joergensen  for most people there is only the approved way only pacifist and only g route after no exceptions makes no sense like when you kill goat mom because you don't trust her people have removed entire channels for a small action and smaller channels stay away from undertale for that because the undertale community wants to force them to have a specific experience instead of letting them do it answering any questions about it they have but the Japanese experience and the English were completely different the Japanese were encouraging her and the English were either saying don't kill or believe g route because a small amount of kills occurred because they only know those 2 outlooks

author: vergil lives
text: @DevilVocano  and ruins experience if they don't play the approved way

author: gamrage
text:
I don't think the issue is the chat telling her to play the pacifist route or anything. It's more of an issue of them being worried that she doesn't know that the game has the option to spare monsters. If she knows that she can spare monsters and still wants to continue to play through the game, that's fine. 
The issue is that she reacts negatively whenever killing key characters. People just want her to know that if she likes a character, she has a choice.

author: Pingu Strategist
text: Seriously, her streams are actually entertaining because she plays the way she wants to play not the way chat wants her to play.

author: Pingu Strategist
text:
@Charley Joergensen  I doubt they watch for the reactions. Because the strongest reactions are from when they realize they are responsible for the choices they made. Otherwise it's just, "Chat, you told me to do this." So there is no feeling of attachment. 

It's most likely just people that want them to play the game "optimally". Those are the kinds of people that look up every single decision online rather than experiencing it for themselves. Who are they to ruin the experience of blind runs??

author: Yog Sothoth
text: Im loving these blind runs. Though I do pray that Some day, a blind streamer will reset the game, load a save file and retry.. they obviously don't want to do it because they are streaming,  but it's actually very easy, and even tempting, to do blind. I honestly thought if anyone, Rushia would do it once out of frustration...I bet she thought about it when she walked back in the beginning, but hesitated because she was streaming.

author: Marcop TSF
text: lol, it's not like she cares or not, she doesn't understand english

author: Sharky Gawrrr
text:
Thank you Rushia for the undertale stream, it sure is a fun game to play for hours. 
See you in the concert tomorrow Rushia!

author: Nexcell Pride
text:
Intense stream ever... :_るんるん:
Also New PC debut, due to technical issues at current PC, that caused about 1 hour delay. 

However, this didn't prevent the stream from being done anyway despite the low frames per second (Rushia normally broadcasts at 60 fps), lacking LiveChat, lacking background and other things... In resume, unconfigured OBS (Stream style remembers various streams until January 2020) 

Anyway, this is a new beginning for Rushia. I don't know what do you think, guys... :_ハート:

And I didn't notice about the interesting "Undertale" gameplay and how she was surviving at many obstacles.

And at ending... No Opening and Ending shown, for Supaachaato Orei Time, she wrote "Supacha Orei Time. Today's Stream is Ended" (Something like the scrolling message at top) 

Well... For Rushia, she needs to rest, meanwhile staff or anyone configures her New PC.
Also congratulations for the New PC debut and the 961000 subs already. :_ちょうちょ:
